alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor; Thurston (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 06 at 9:44AM PST until December 07 at 8:19PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... South Prairie Creek at South Prairie affecting Pierce County. Cowlitz River At Randle affecting Lewis County. Nisqually River Near National affecting Lewis and Pierce Counties. Newaukum River Near Chehalis affecting Lewis County. Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Thurston and Grays Harbor Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Washington... Puyallup River Near Orting affecting Pierce County. .Heavy rain is over but flood waters continue to make their way down rivers and streams. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River above Grand Mound. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 141.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Thurston County will flood several roads in Independence Valley including James Road, Independence Road, and Moon road. Flood waters will also cover nearby farm lands. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 141.8 feet. - Flood stage is 141.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM PST Wednesday was 141.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 142.0 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 1045 AM PST.
